WORKFLOW:
1. Make code changes locally
2. Start local services: scripts/local-start.cmd or scripts/local-start.sh
3. Test locally: scripts/local-test.cmd or scripts/local-test.sh
4. Verify in browser: http://localhost:3000
5. Check Docker logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs
6. Fix any issues and repeat

LOCAL ENVIRONMENT:
- MongoDB: localhost:27017
- Redis: localhost:6379
- All services run in Docker containers
- Use .env.local for configuration
- Hot reload enabled for development

COMMANDS:
Windows (cmd.exe):
- Start: scripts\local-start.cmd
- Test: scripts\local-test.cmd
- Stop: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down
- Logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f

Git Bash:
- Start: ./scripts/local-start.sh
- Test: ./scripts/local-test.sh
- Stop: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down
- Logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f

DEBUGGING:
- Check container status: docker ps
- View logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs [service]
- Restart service: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml restart [service]
- Shell into container: docker exec -it [container] sh

FILE RESTRICTIONS:
- Can edit all project files
- Cannot modify production server files
- Cannot modify .git directory
- Be careful with package.json and package-lock.json

TESTING:
- Always test locally before committing
- Use browser automation: node scripts/browser-test.js
- Check all API endpoints work
- Verify UI renders correctly
- Test authentication flow
- Test economy features

GIT WORKFLOW:
- Make changes locally
- Test thoroughly
- Commit with descriptive messages
- Push to GitHub
- Let CI/CD handle deployment
